00211 typedef struct {
00212         buffer *scheme; /* scheme without colon or slashes ( "http" or "https" ) */
00213 
00214         /* authority with optional portnumber ("site.name" or "site.name:8080" ) NOTE: without "username:password@" */
00215         buffer *authority;
00216 
00217         /* path including leading slash ("/" or "/index.html") - urldecoded, and sanitized  ( buffer_path_simplify() && buffer_urldecode_path() ) */
00218         buffer *path;
00219         buffer *path_raw; /* raw path, as sent from client. no urldecoding or path simplifying */
00220         buffer *query; /* querystring ( everything after "?", ie: in "/index.php?foo=1", query is "foo=1" ) */
00221 } request_uri;

00324         off_t  global_bytes_per_second_cnt;
00325         /* server-wide traffic-shaper
00326          *
00327          * each context has the counter which is inited once
00328          * per second by the global_kbytes_per_second config-var
00329          *
00330          * as soon as global_kbytes_per_second gets below 0
00331          * the connected conns are "offline" a little bit
00332          *
00333          * the problem:
00334          * we somehow have to lose our "we are writable" signal
00335          * on the way.
00336          *
00337          */
00338         off_t *global_bytes_per_second_cnt_ptr; /*  */
00339

00341         SSL_CTX *ssl_ctx;
00342 #endif
